2.text: Wash your apples in cold water.

3.text: Cut the apples into small cubes.

5.text: Add 1 teaspoon (4 grams) of raw sugar for each apple.

6.text: Cover the jar with a cheesecloth.

7.text: Keep the jar in a warm, dark place.

8.text: Stir the mixture once or twice a day.

9.text: Wait for the apples to sink to the bottom of the jar.

10.text: Strain the apples from the cider and pour the cider back into the jar.

11.text: Leave the cider to ferment for 3 to 6 weeks, stirring every few days.

12.text: Transfer the fermented vinegar to a lidded glass jar and store.
